BSTrade.util.fn module¶

BSTrade.util.fn.attach_timer(cls: type, limit=10) → list[source]¶

Attach performance timer to class

Find only subclass’s or override methods and print consumed times of the methods.

cls : class
Class that we want to add timers.
limit : int, optional
Print limit timer (ms).
method_list : array
Returning attached methods information.

These are written in doctest format, and should illustrate how to use the function.

>>> class A(object):
...     pass

>>> attach_timer(A)
BSTrade.util.fn.perf_timer(argument, debug=True, limit=1)[source]¶
